name: N-(4-decylphenyl)-4-methylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2315
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine base, with a melting point around 106 degrees Celsius, based on the fact that piperazine itself has a melting point around that value. For the methyl group, let's say it reduces it very slightly, say -2 degrees Celsius. The decyl group will increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and van der Waals forces but will also introduce a rigid structure, which might raise it by +20 degrees Celsius. The phenyl group will also increase the melting point due to the ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
